p:
The base model, and one including initial seedling height, were tied for highest-ranked models predicting growth of S. chrysophylla seedlings, each holding nearly half of the model weight (Base w
i = 0.45, Height w
i = 0.45; S7 Table). The random effect of plot explained 1% of the variation in plant growth (ICC = 0.010), indicating that a mixed model may not have been more informative than a traditional linear model for predicting plant growth in this case. However, the random effect of plot was retained to account for micro-variation between plots in the model, and to maintain model comparability across species.
